element.name: Films About Ghosts by Donnacha, Traditional Cache (2/1.5)
element.long-description:
This is my first cache and is located just outside Enniskerry village in Co. Wicklow in a forest called Carrickgollogan. Once you get to the car park and start your trek the terrain is very good. When you arrive at the tower you have to walk over some rocks and some prickley bushes, so be careful if it is wet. Please remember to replace the rocks.
The cache is an ammo box. The cache is hidden close to the tower and will be quite easy to find. The cache is covered by some rocks, so please be careful and put them back when finished.
Some of the road will not be on your base map, so I have the coordinates of the couple turns you will have to take. I suggest you print them out and bring them with you.
As you come into Enniskerry village take a right. You will be following the R117. As the top of this hill, take a right just before the Texaco petrol station. (N53 12.178 W6 10.554) Go 300 meters down the road and take the first left. (N53 12.246 W6 10.255) Go 1 mile up this hill and take the first right at the top. (N53 13.225 W6 10.208) Keep on driving (or walking) for 285 meters and the car park is on your left. (N53 13.178 W6 09.963) You are now on foot (if you were driving); follow the path from the car park. It's about a 15 min walk to the cache from here. Take the first turn left off this path, it's about 300 meters ahead of you. You are heading for the tower. Keep on walking straight, you will see the tower. Once you are at the tower, it's up to you to find the cache!! Take a minute or two to enjoy the view from the tower. Enjoy
Donnacha.
Visit the Geocaching Ireland discussion forum HERE
element.encoded-hints: Cache is 252ft north of the tower. It is hidden in a wall, on the tower side of the wall. The cache is close to a fence post. There's and old rusted bit of barbed wire hanging off the fence.

ul.li:
2010-05-28T14:39:25Z : Found it by EoghanHassan
Great view

2010-04-19T19:00:00Z : Found it by Peta Amalka
It was a bit spiked but quite easy to find. TFTC

2010-02-27T20:00:00Z : Found it by EIMHK
Found it - there were actually two places along the wall where there was rusted barbed wire, it happened that we were searching at the wrong spot, but then we found the other rusted barbed wire and there it was!
Out: GC
TFTC

2010-01-30T20:00:00Z : Found it by Alastair74
Found this with Gilliancclarke and Wildfowler great day. This cache has to be the most memorable of the day/ night and the most satisfying to find and i think the rest of the story has been told by gillian and Wildfowler.

2010-01-30T20:00:00Z : Found it by wildfowler
Down in Wicklow for the day with gilliancclarke & Alastair74 for a day of caching! Took a short cut to this one, probably not the best idea in the dark but it did make it even more memorable! The things we do for a smiley! See Gillian's log for her version! I didn't think it was that bad a walk! [;)] TFTC

wpt.name: GC70E8
wpt.desc: Films About Ghosts by Donnacha, Traditional Cache (2/1.5)

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: Films About Ghosts
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
This is my first cache and is located just outside Enniskerry village in Co. Wicklow in a forest called Carrickgollogan. Once you get to the car park and start your trek the terrain is very good. When you arrive at the tower you have to walk over some rocks and some prickley bushes, so be careful if it is wet. Please remember to replace the rocks.

The cache is an ammo box. The cache is hidden close to the tower and will be quite easy to find. The cache is covered by some rocks, so please be careful and put them back when finished.

Some of the road will not be on your base map, so I have the coordinates of the couple turns you will have to take. I suggest you print them out and bring them with you.

As you come into Enniskerry village take a right. You will be following the R117. As the top of this hill, take a right just before the Texaco petrol station. (N53 13.178 W6 09.963) You are now on foot (if you were driving); follow the path from the car park. It's about a 15 min walk to the cache from here. Take the first turn left off this path, it's about 300 meters ahead of you. You are heading for the tower. Keep on walking straight, you will see the tower. Once you are at the tower, it's up to you to find the cache!! Take a minute or two to enjoy the view from the tower. Enjoy
Donnacha.
